trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Tinfoil Security | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Tinfoil Security | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Tinfoil Security with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Tinfoil Security with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Tinfoil Security.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Tinfoil Security.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Tinfoil Security single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Tinfoil Security single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Tinfoil Security will be able to single sign into the application at your Tinfoil Security company site (identity provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Tinfoil Security will be able to single sign into the application at your Tinfoil Security company site (identity provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Tinfoil Security
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Tinfoil Security

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Tinfoil Security.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Tinfoil Security.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Tinfoil Security.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Tinfoil Security.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Tinfoil Security, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Tinfoil Security, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Tinfoil Security</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Tinfoil Security</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Tinfoil Security with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Tinfoil Security with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on for Tinfoil Security requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on for Tinfoil Security requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Tinfoil Security application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Tinfoil Security application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Tinfoil Security page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Tinfoil Security page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Tinfoil Security Reply URL textbox, type your Tinfoil Security Assertion Consumer Service (ACS) URL (e.g.: "https://www.tinfoilsecurity.com/saml/consume", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Tinfoil Security Reply URL textbox, type your Tinfoil Security Assertion Consumer Service (ACS) URL (e.g.: "https://www.tinfoilsecurity.com/saml/consume", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: You should be able to get the ACS URL from Tinfoil Security Metadata (https://www.tinfoilsecurity.com/saml/metadata).
trans-unit.target: You should be able to get the ACS URL from Tinfoil Security Metadata (https://www.tinfoilsecurity.com/saml/metadata).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Tinfoil Security page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally as c:\\Tinfoil Security.cer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Tinfoil Security page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally as c:\\Tinfoil Security.cer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Tinfoil Security company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Tinfoil Security company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the top, click My Account.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the top, click My Account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Dashboard</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Dashboard</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Security.
trans-unit.target: Click Security.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Security</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Security</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Single Sign-On configuration page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Single Sign-On configuration page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Enable SAML.
trans-unit.target: Select Enable SAML.

trans-unit.source: Click Manual Configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click Manual Configuration.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Tinfoil Security dialog page, copy the SAML SSO URL value, and then paste it into the SAML Post URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Tinfoil Security dialog page, copy the SAML SSO URL value, and then paste it into the SAML Post URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the SAML Certificate Fingerprint textbox.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the SAML Certificate Fingerprint textbox.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Copy Your Account ID.
trans-unit.target: Copy Your Account ID.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Attributes to open the SAML Token Attributes dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Attributes to open the SAML Token Attributes dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To add the required attribute mappings, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To add the required attribute mappings, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click add user attribute.
trans-unit.target: Click add user attribute.

trans-unit.source: In the Attribute Name textbox, type accountid.
trans-unit.target: In the Attribute Name textbox, type accountid.

trans-unit.source: In the Attribute Value textbox, paste the account ID value you have copied in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: In the Attribute Value textbox, paste the account ID value you have copied in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: Click Complete.
trans-unit.target: Click Complete.

trans-unit.source: Click Apply Changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Apply Changes.

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Tinfoil Security, they must be provisioned into Tinfoil Security.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Tinfoil Security, they must be provisioned into Tinfoil Security.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Tinfoil Security, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Tinfoil Security, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: If the user is a part of an Enterprise account, you need to contact the Tinfoil Security support team to get the user account created.
trans-unit.target: If the user is a part of an Enterprise account, you need to contact the Tinfoil Security support team to get the user account created.

trans-unit.source: If the user is a regular Tinfoil Security SaaS user, then the user can add a collaborator to any of the user’s sites.
trans-unit.target: If the user is a regular Tinfoil Security SaaS user, then the user can add a collaborator to any of the user’s sites.

trans-unit.source: This triggers a process to send an invitation to the specified email to create a new Tinfoil Security user account.
trans-unit.target: This triggers a process to send an invitation to the specified email to create a new Tinfoil Security user account.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Tinfoil Security user account creation tools or APIs provided by Tinfoil Security to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Tinfoil Security user account creation tools or APIs provided by Tinfoil Security to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Tinfoil Security **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Tinfoil Security **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
